individual_metadata.synopsis: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 6.22, 31.57, 366.464. Talk with Lump

automatic_ordering.reasoning: There is only one session provided, and with only one session, no ordering constraints (i.e., predecessor or successor relationships) or mutual exclusiveness constraints can be deduced.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Would you like to work for me?

40.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
40.text: Mm, mm, mm. Fortune favours my belly, for there is no meat more succulent than a stranger's.

3.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
3.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: You're quite eloquent for an ogre.

63.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
63.text: I see it. How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

83.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
83.text: How regrettable. Tell me, sweet creature: does your flesh taste as honeyed as I could hope for?

35.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
35.text: Unh. You wound me, creature. I can hardly resist you.
35.context: NodeContext: Absolutely stricken by this creature he would LOVE to eat

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I'll leave that to your imagination.

7.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
7.text: Now speak or go, before my cravings conquer me.
7.context: NodeContext: Should suddenly sound all ogre-ish and stupid. He's talking to his stupid brothers.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I notice you don't bear a brand of your own.

17.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
17.text: I've no use for the Absolute - or any god. I follow two masters only: gluttony and greed.

50.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
50.text: The goblins understand my appetites. They sate my hunger for gold...

45.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
45.text: ...and the rest sate my hunger for meat.

72.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
72.text: I simply look for marks. Gold is more than sufficient compensation.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Forget the goblins - why not work for me instead?

8.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
8.text: I am by all accounts a student of higher commerce and extortion.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I'll give you [6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54] gold if I can call you into battle.

79.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
79.text: A serenade to my ears, and a boon to my belly. We've a bargain, my tasty kibble!

73.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
73.text: Take my bonehorn. One blow, and the ground will quake with my family name.

60.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
60.text: Use it when the need arises - and never a moment before.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You're rather well-spoken for one of your kind.

29.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
29.text: Am I not astonishing? A robust diet makes for a shrewd mind, you see. I am a gourmand...

1.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
1.text: ...and you, a delicacy - were I so lucky.

90.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
90.text: ...and you, a delicacy - unless you bear the mark, of course.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I've seen few other ogres in these parts.

54.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
54.text: Mm - your candour makes you all the more enticing.

71.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
71.text: I follow the scents of blood and gold to all lands fertile, friend.

44.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
44.text: And this land proves particularly... fruitful.

20.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
20.text: I will keep close. When you are ready, sound the horn.

61.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
61.text: Take my bonehorn. One blow, and... just a moment. It's been thieved - and I know the culprit.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'll give you [463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca] gold - after you fight for me.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I'll give you [463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca] gold - after you fight for me.

4.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
4.text: A twice-played serenade to my ears, my tasty kibble. We have a bargain!

69.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
69.text: Come, now. An ogre feasts not on promises.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I'll pay you in the flesh of the fallen - you'll have your fill.

75.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
75.text: A brilliant notion, and a boon to my aching belly. We have a deal, my tasty kibble!

21.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
21.text: A slip of the tongue - you meant to make a better offer, surely.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I'll pay you in the flesh of the fallen - you'll have your fill.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I've changed my mind. Forget about it.

51.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
51.text: Oh, but you do love to tease.

55.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
55.text: Alas - not so much as a nibble.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I'll do you one better - I'm one of her chosen disciples.

34.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
34.text: Indeed? How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

52.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
52.text: How regrettable. Tell me, sweet creature: does your flesh taste as honeyed as I could hope for?

38.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
38.text: I expect more than your word. Show me your flesh.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Flash your arm at him. There you are. You could see the brand, could you not?

91.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
91.text: Yes, yes - the mark is unmistakable. How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

80.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
80.text: Yes, yes - the mark is unmistakable. Tell me, sweet creature: does your flesh taste as honeyed as I could hope for?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Do not test the Absolute's finest, ogre. You would not survive Her wrath.

81.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
81.text: Ha! Did you expect The Enlightened to fall for such a crude ruse?

49.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
49.text: Spoken with the confidence only a True Soul could muster!

67.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
67.text: How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

41.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
41.text: Tell me, sweet creature: does your flesh taste as honeyed as I could hope for?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm not your friend, and I'm not food. Back off.
